message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a new approach to natural language understanding using 2D Convolutional Neural Networks, which involves treating input text as an image and learning local and global semantics of sentences from visual patterns of words. This approach combines computer vision and natural language processing techniques, making it likely to belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-categories. The paper also presents results for text classification and dialog modeling, indicating that it could be relevant to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. Finally, the paper uses techniques to extract semantically meaningful features from images with text, which could be relevant to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category.
